description: Erection of roof extensions to provide four self-contained residential units facilitated by raising of roof ridge, rear dormer and two front roof lights (to northernmost building);  erection of roof extension to provide additional floor with inset private terraces (to central building);  one storey roof extension (to eastern building) and alterations to fenestration to all street facing elevations; with additional waste and cycle storage
decision_conditions: <p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; line-height: 1.2;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Prior to commencement of the roof extension to the eastern building details, including sections at a scale of 1:20, of a bio-diverse, substrate-based extensive biodiverse roof (80mm minimum depth) including long-term management plan, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the development and shall thereafter be retained and maintained.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; line-height: 1.2;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: To enhance the character and ecology of the development, to provide undisturbed refuges for wildlife, to promote sustainable urban drainage and to enhance the performance and efficiency of the proposed building.</span></p><div><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"><br></span></div>

<p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; line-height: 1.2;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Prior to occupation of the </span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">units </span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">hereby permitted, the bins stores shown on the approved plans shall be </span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;"> provided and maintained as such thereafter. The refuse bins must be brought to a collection point within 10 metres of a public highway on collection day only unless otherwise agreed as part of a waste contract with the Local Planning Authority. </span></p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; line-height: 1.2;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: To ensure that adequate provision for the safe and secure storage of refuse and recycling is made for future occupiers, in the interest of safeguarding highway safety and the appearance of the wider area</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; line-height: 1.2;"><br></p>

<p>Detailed drawings and full particulars of the following shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the start of the relevant part of the works.&nbsp; The works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved:</p><p>a) Details of all new and replacement windows in the form of a 1:20 elevation of each window type, showing the pane pattern, together with 1:5 sections of the frames showing the material and dimensions and 1:1 sections of the glazing bars showing the depth of the glazing units;</p><p>b) Details of the proposed rooflights in the form of a manufacturer’s illustration and specification;</p><p>c) Details of all new entrance and bin doors in the form of a 1:20 elevation with the materials and dimensions shown;</p><p>d) Details of all window and balcony railings in the form of a typical 1:10 elevation of each type, with materials and dimensions shown.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest of the Conservation Area and the setting of the nearby listed buildings</p>

<span id="docs-internal-guid-c80f4d7c-7fff-d8f9-b85f-7e3642f82c8e"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved a minimum of </span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">four</span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;"> Swift nesting bricks and/or boxes shall be provided at or close to eaves level of the development hereby approved. The bricks/boxes shall be retained thereafter in perpetuity.&nbsp;</span></p><br><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: in the interests of biodiversity.</span></p><br></span>

<p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; line-height: 1.13809; padding: 0pt 0pt 8pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Prior to commencement of above ground works, a detailed Construction Logistics and Management Plan covering the matters set out below must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority</span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; line-height: 1.13809;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">The construction management plan covering all phases of above ground works shall include but not be limited to the following:</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-left: 35.4331pt; line-height: 1.13809; padding: 0pt 0pt 8pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">i) A construction method statement covering all phases of above ground works to include details of noise control measures, vibration and dust control measures including to preserve air quality;</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-left: 35.4331pt; line-height: 1.13809; padding: 0pt 0pt 8pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">ii) Details and locations of all noisy activities including mobile plant machinery, and details of the best practicable means of mitigation employed against noise and vibration in accordance with British Standard Code of Practice BS 5228.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-left: 35.4331pt; line-height: 1.13809; padding: 0pt 0pt 8pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">iii) Details of the locations where deliveries will be undertaken; the size and number of lorries expected to access the site daily; the access arrangements (including turning provision if applicable); construction traffic routing; details of parking suspensions (if required) and the duration of construction.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-left: 35.4331pt; line-height: 1.13809; padding: 0pt 0pt 8pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">iv) Deliveries to site and associated with removal of plant, equipment, machinery and waste from the site must only take place within the permitted hours detailed above.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; margin-left: 35.4331pt; line-height: 1.13809;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">v) Procedures for maintaining good public relations including complaint management, public consultation and liaison - Arrangements for liaison with the Council’s Community Safety Team.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; line-height: 1.13809; padding: 0pt 0pt 8pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">The development shall only be implemented in accordance with the details and measures approved as part of the construction management plan, which shall be maintained throughout the entire construction period.&nbsp;</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; line-height: 1.13809;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON</span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">:</span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;"> To ensure that occupiers of residential premises do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of noise nuisance during site activities</span></p>

<div>The cycle parking shown on the approved plans shall be secure, covered and lockable and must be implemented prior to first occupation of the approved units.&nbsp;</div><div><br></div><div>The storage spaces and stands must be maintained in good working order for the lifetime of the development.&nbsp;</div><div><br></div><div>REASON: In the interests of sustainable transport</div>

<p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; line-height: 1.2;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Works shall not commence until full details of all materials to be used on the external surfaces of the building, including a sample panel of the proposed brickwork to be built on site, have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing. </span>&nbsp;The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved, and shall be maintained as such thereafter.</p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; line-height: 1.2;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the development is satisfactory.</span></p>

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<p>The windows shown on the approved elevations as obscure glazed shall be non-opening below 1.7 metres above finished floor level and obscure glazed to that height.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To protect the amenity of neighbouring occupiers.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Prior to occupation of the development hereby approved, a certification by an accredited PV installer confirming that an array with an overall capacity of at least 1.25 kWp has been installed on the roof of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.</p><p>REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and securing sustainable development</p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

<p>All new and replacement external rainwater and soil pipes shall be of traditional design, formed in cast iron and painted black.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building&nbsp;</p><p><br></p>

<p>The proposed alterations to the fenestration of the existing building at ground, first and second floors to restore the fenestrations traditional design, proportions and materials as shown on the approved plans shall be undertaken as part of the development and completed in their entirety prior to the first occupation of the new units.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the benefits of the planning proposal to the existing building are adequately implemented&nbsp;</p>
